I mean - no matter how perfect things seem at first - people make mistakes, sometimes.

(tears welling in her eyes) But, Harry... (then, with the horrible thought) Oh... I see. You don't want me. You don't love me any more. Is that it? (stifling a sob) Are you telling me you don't want me?

(wildly, breaking) Want you? I love you and want you more than -- (rises quickly, walks away ) But I'm giving you up, do you hear? I'm not worth even the sound of your name! Beatrix gets up and hurries to him as WE PAN.
Oh, my darling - what's wrong? Tell me!
I've no right to you - I've thrown it away!
Nothing's done that can't be -- (CONTINUED)
But it's done! I've destroyed paradise - Our paradise -
(the mother now) Oh - you are ill - tell me what's really wrong! Don't keep it pent up inside. You've always said we could discuss anything between us.
There are things you can't voice in Heaven. Just believe me... (turning his back to her) You're giving me up, do you hear? Go - go inside - now - while I can't see you -!
(turning him half to her) Darling - it's all right. Just take me in your arms.
Oh, don't my angel! Angel - Angel of Heaven, don't say any more -!
(putting her arms around him) There - there, darling - hold me close. Don't think of anything - of whatever it is - just hold me a minute.

(pulling her hand from him) No! No - I can't! I'd give my soul to -- but I have no soul! (he clenches his fist and covers his face with the other hand, bowing his head) I'm like - (he pauses, searching for the word) - like the living dead...! Beatrix now enfolds him in her arms again. His head rests her shoulder. His arms go around her, weakened for a mome in his anguish. (CONTINUED)
(soothingly) Oh, my poor dear suffering love. Be quiet... s-s-h-don't say any more.
(sobbing) Oh, Bee - my darling -!
(softly) Rest now... rest... They are quiet for a second. Then Jekyll lifts his head quickly and starts as if to leave.
(trying to hold him, panicky) I won't let you go. You love me - I won't let you go.

(his voice rising) That's why I'm giving you up! Because I'll love you till the end of time! (raising his gaze aloft, as he backs away, Beatrix staring after him aghast that he is going, that she can't hold him) This is my proof! This is my penance! He turns and walks hurriedly o.s.
(starting after him, then stops) Harry - come back - Harry -- She then breaks into violent sobs, falters, and sinks to ground, prone.  270 271 140.

Jekyll is hurrying toward the CAMERA. In the b.g., Beatri is sobbing on the ground. WE PAN Jekyll as he comes aroun the side of the house and stops. 0.s. he hears her sobbin faintly. He is terribly tempted to go back. He half turns and looks. He cannot stand the sight of what he sees. He leans in weary torture against the side of the house, clo his eyes. Suddenly a look of horror comes over his face. looks down at his hands. WE PAN DOWN to see his hand star to change. WE PAN UP to Jekyll's face. He looks down at h other hand. His throat starts to constrict, his face to change.
(wildly, looking up) Oh - no - no - don't let me - save me - don't let me -! But the metamorphosis is well on its way.

She still lies on the ground, sobbing. Then, Jekyll's fee and legs appear slowly in the SCENE. They stand right nex to her. She is aware of them. With a little sob, she half rises, reaches out and enfolds the legs, pressing her che against the knees.

(murmuring) Oh, you did come back... Oh, my darling.... For answer there is an ugly chuckle o.s. Hyde's hands com down into the frame and clutch her arms. Beatrix in puzzlement, and then in dawning horror reacts to the chuc and the hands. In almost the same moment, Hyde lifts her and she is face to face with him. For a second, she is fr with fright, then screams as Hyde's face bends towards he
(after her scream) Father! Father..! Hyde laughs wildly and starts to struggle with Beatrix.  272 273 274 275 141.

He is coming out of the drawing room on a dead run. WE PA HIM over to Beatrix and Hyde. Hyde drops Beatrix who fain and slips to the ground. Sir Charles makes a gallant lung at Hyde, but Hyde sends him reeling against the wall. The with a wild animal laugh he leaps for his hat and stick. Charles, however, recovers in time to intercept his progr around the fountain.

(calling) Help! Hobson - call the police! Help -! Hyde raises his stick and lays it across Sir Charles' hea Sir Charles stumbles back and falls to the ground. Hyde l on top of him like a panther, and bashes the stick agains Sir Charles' head three or four times in rapid succession The stick breaks with a final sickening blow. In the b.g. Hobson and a footman come hurrying from the drawing room.

Here - what's going on -! They spy Hyde and come after him. Hyde gets up and WE PAN HIM the length of the garden on the run. Hobson kneels be Sir Charles' prostrate body as the footman gives chase af Hyde around the corner of the house.
Hyde comes running from the garden. He stops for a second and looks up the street.
A constable comes around the corner on the run, dimly discernible under a gas light.
He runs o.s. down the street in the opposite direction ju as the footman appears and the constable comes running up
(pointing in direction of Hyde) There he goes! It's the monster! The constable runs o.s. after Hyde, blowing his whistle.  276 277 278 279 280 281 282 283 142.

Hyde comes tearing down in toward camera. In a second, th constable appears after him. Another man or two, passers- at the far entrance, take up the chase. Hyde leaps over a fence. When the constable arrives at fence, he blows his whistle again.
He reacts to distant whistle, runs for it o.s.
He runs past camera into b.g. A small group of idlers are standing at the corner. They block his progress and he bo through them, knocking a couple down. Ad 1ib yells of sur and anger.
The two constables come in chase, followed by more people
Stop that man!
As constables come running up.
(pointing) That way, constable! WE PAN AND PICK UP Hyde, his cape flying, leaping down th street in the b.g. The rest give chase.
He comes flying along and darts up the walk to the house. O.s. comes the sound of the constable's whistle.
He runs up the steps, vaults the balustrade and hurls his body sidewise through the waiting-room window at the side the door.
Hyde lands sprawling amidst the shattered glass. He scram up and leaps out into the foyer.  284 285 286 287 288 289 290 143.
Hyde enters. Poole comes in from past camera.

(recognizing Hyde) Here, here - how did -? But he gets no further as Hyde, with a roar, bowls him as and ducks out the back door toward the lab. Poole hurries the door, opens it. 0.s. we hear crowd noises and whistle
As he leaps across the bridge in the back courtyard to Jekyll's laboratory.
Hyde comes through door from courtyard, closes door, lock it. Then he goes to door of lab, opens it, ducks inside, we hear him lock this door.
Poole and the constables come running across the bridge.
He's gone into the laboratory! WE PAN THEM to the first door. They find it locked.
(putting shoulder to door) Heave, Bill!
He is frantically looking for various vials to mix the po He upsets and breaks things in his fury.
A constable, the footman, Hobson and Lanyon are leaning o Sir Charles' body. Lanyon is shaking his head woefully. T constable shows Lanyon half of a stick.

(taking stick, then after a second) Yes... I was afraid so. (rising) Come - I think I can take you to your man.
Hyde is feverishly mixing the potion, having to make some its ingredients not already prepared. O.s., there is a cr of door bursting. Then hammering on the laboratory door.
The courtyard door is down. The constables and Poole are hammering at the door of the lab.
In his haste, he knocks over a large glass jar. It crashe
(suddenly listening) He's in there! Open up! (then, as just silence comes) Come on, Bill! Bill has run in with a crow-bar, and after two or three t they break the door down.
They come running down the stairs. As WE PAN WE PICK UP J who is just staggering to his feet from the floor.
(amazed) Dr. Jekyll, sir! That frightful maniac broke through the house and -
I know. He struck me over the head. (indicating, to constable) Quick, man! He went out by the back! (CONTINUED)
The constables hurry to the back door, o.s.
I didn't even know you were home, sir. Are you badly hurt?
I'll - I'll be all right. The two constables come from the back door.
(to Jekyll) This here door's locked.
(impatiently, pointing up stairs) Then you better get round through the front! The two constables leap up the stairs, just as Lanyon, an constable and an inspector in plain clothes come hurrying in.
(looking at Jekyll below) Wait!
(explaining) He ducked through the back and locked the door after him!

(in great strain) No, he didn't! He's still down here. They watch him, amazed, and follow down the steps to the proper. He approaches Jekyll. Jekyll looks at him, tired, wan. There are tears in Jekyll's eyes as he waits for the word by Lanyon. Lanyon, too, is greatly affected. He seem as though he can't say the word.
(finally gathers himself - pointing to Jekyll) There - Heaven help him.
(shocked) Dr. Lanyon -! (CONTINUED)
(Puzzled) I know this gentleman. He's Dr. Jekyll.
(tears in his eyes now) I know. Nevertheless, there's your man.
You can't be serious, Dr. Lanyon. I -
(suddenly pointing) Watch -! For Jekyll has already started to turn back to Hyde again They all watch him in awe and horror as he goes through t metamorphosis.
He backs away slowly.
Their jaws are dropping.
He looks away. He cannot stand it.

For he is now almost completely Hyde. He comes out of his writhings as such. He looks about at the others, as thoug he has just seen them for the first time. He is more best and awful in physique and manner than we have ever seen h in the transformation. With a sudden yell he throws a hug jar at the officers, and ducks around the table. (NOTE: I the following ensuing struggle ad lib commands from the inspector should come at the proper time: "Grab him - hol him - don't let him get up those stairs - guard that door etc.) Hyde practically wrecks the lab in eluding his purs He knocks them this way and that. He leaps across tables up on shelves, pulling them down. He growls and snarls an laughs in glee every time he eludes them.
This during middle of fight. Lanyon sees the gun in the inspector's hand. (CONTINUED)
(pleading) Shoot him, inspector - shoot him! That would be his wish!
(grimly ) Must take him if we can! (darting o.s.) Hold him now!

The constables seem just about to have Hyde cornered, whe with another wild leap, he gets to a set of surgical instruments, and pulls out a large knife. With another ye he makes a leap for freedom, brandishing his weapon. As h gets by the large apparatus on the table, the inspector l him have it with the revolver. Hyde wheels, drops across table, shattering some of the apparatus. They start crowd around him in silent awe, Poole crying with audible sobs.
(like a plea) Dr. Jekyll... Dr. Jekyll..... !

There is a strange light on it. As if in answer to Poole' plea, the face starts slowly and mystically changing back that of the handsome Jekyll - a face peaceful in death - if in death - without struggle or torture - Jekyll was restored to himself for Eternity. WE PULL BACK SLOWLY for tableau.
